intro: Eukrania cyananthus, commonly known as the blue-flowered eukrania, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers, which are typically tubular and arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Eukrania cyananthus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
